function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Negative impact on real gdp stability","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Contagious spread of economic instability","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reduction in economic activity","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Localised supply chains are found to be more vulnerable to shocks for most countries.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Domestic shocks account for about half of the variation in real gdp due to shocks, illustrating that domestic shocks may be at least as important as a source of instability as foreign shocks.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"For 16 out of 22 countries or regions included in the model, real gdp stability falls when all shocks are considered.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Contagious diseases propagation within interconnected supply chains.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Greater localisation of value chains would add further gdp losses to the economic slowdown caused by the pandemic.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reduction in global real gdp by more than 5% relative to the interconnected regime.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Import and export demand falling in real terms proportionally more than real gdp and domestic production.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased reliance on domestic production","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Rigid international supply chains","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Gdp losses from economic slowdown","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Centralization of manufacturing and industry in certain countries","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High-income economies as key hubs for service sector","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Exposure to foreign supply shocks for smaller economies","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Systemic implications of central countries and industries in the global production network","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased centrality of china in global production networks","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"High concentration of market share in a few countries for computer-related products and phones.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Extreme concentration of trade in a few importing/exporting firms.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on foreign value-added and export demand in global value chains.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Low diversity of suppliers or buyers in supply chains increasing the probability of disruption
